body.p: features a user-friendly administration interface where you can moderate comments, manage users, view statistics, and configure various settings, notifications, and other components of the comment system. This administration interface is reached by logging in to your Feedback account in the administration login page ().You can also reach the administration interface from the comments area in any web page where it is installed by logging in and selecting Home from the drop-down menu to the right of your name.
All the various pages within the administration interface have a common ribbon at the top with some actions to help you navigate through the interface.
The components in that ribbon include:

dlentry.dd: Clicking the Oxygen Feedback logo at the left side of the ribbon will navigate to the Dashboard page.
Clicking the Dashboard action will navigate to the Dashboard page.

Clicking the Sites drop-down menu displays a list of your site configurations, making it easy to navigate to a particular configuration from anywhere in the interface. It shows the 5 most recent sites, followed by 5 sites with pending comments, and there is a View All Sites action at the bottom of the list to see the rest of the site configurations.
Clicking the Help icon displays a menu where you can choose to open the User Guide or you can choose About to see information about the current version for the application.
Clicking this drop-down menu provides access to the profile management page, subscription plans page, usage statistics page, and Log out action.

section.title: Dashboard
section.p: When you log in to the administration interface, you start with the Dashboard page. This page is especially helpful for those who want to integrate the Feedback commenting component in multiple websites. It aggregates basic information about all the existing site configurations that has the current user assigned as Owner, Admin, or Moderator.

This page is divided into two panes. The left pane (Sites) displays all the existing site configurations along with information such as the Owner. The site configurations with pending comments are listed first, and then the rest are sorted alphabetically. The right pane (Activity Stream) displays all the activity for the site configurations including information about the person who made the change and details about each activity. There are also several components in each pane that help you to filter the information or navigate to a certain page:
Both panes have a filter drop-down menu at the top-right corner. If you do not want to see the information for all site configurations, you can choose to filter it by the site configurations that you are assigned as the Owner, Admin, or Moderator.
In the left pane, there is a widget to the right of the filter drop-down menu. Clicking this widget opens the Sites page where all the site configurations are displayed in a tile format.
In the left pane, if you click on the name of the site configuration, it will open the Comments page where comments can be moderated and managed for the particular configuration.
In the left pane, if you hover over the colored bar to the right of the site configuration name, it will display the number of comments for that site by status type.
In the left pane, you can see the number of community members for each site configuration to the right of the colored bar. If you click this number, it will open the Community management page where you can see all the management team members for the site configuration as well as all the user who have posted a comment on the website where the commenting system is installed.
In the right pane, if you click on the name of the page (or the navigation widget to the far right side), it will open the particular webpage where the comment exists.
In the right pane, if you click on the name of the site configuration (or the version number), it will open the Comments page where comments can be moderated and managed for the particular configuration.

p.note: No matter what page you are on within the administration interface, clicking on the Oxygen Feedback logo at the top-left corner will navigate back to the main Sites page.

section.title: Sites Page
section.p: If you click the widget () to the right of the filter drop-down menu in the left pane of the Dashboard page, it opens the Sites page. This page displays each site configurations as a tile. Each tile displays the logo, name, and description for the particular site configuration. The avatar for the site Owner is displayed at the top-right corner of each tile (you can hover over the avatar to see their name). Also, if the site configuration has the Comment Moderation option enabled, the number of pending comments are displayed if users have posted comments that have not yet been moderated. The tiles for site configurations with pending comments are listed first, and then the rest of the tiles are sorted alphabetically.

You can click anywhere in the center box of a tile to open the Comments page for that particular configuration. This page is used to moderate and manage comments. You can click the Settings button at the bottom-right corner of a tile to open the General Settings page for that particular configuration. This page is where you can edit the logo, name, or description of a site configuration and it includes some other options that can be set according to your needs.

This page also includes the Add site button at the top-right corner. You can click this button to create a site configuration. If you have a lot of site configurations, you can use the Search bar to filter the tiles. The filter component looks for the entered search terms in the name and description of the site configurations.
